flashcards.kikuyu: Past Tense - Two Types (Moments Ago & Early Today)
flashcards.english: Moments Ago (kũra=to start): 1st: Ndokĩra/Twokĩra, 2nd: Wokĩra/Mwokĩra, 3rd: Okĩra/Mokĩra. Example: Ndokĩra dagĩka ikũmi ciathira (I started ten minutes ago). Early Today (kwĩthamba=to shower): 1st: Ndĩthambire/Twĩthambire, 2nd: Wĩthambire/Mwĩthambire, 3rd: Ethambire/Methambire. Example: Ndĩthambire na maĩ mahoro (I showered with warm water)
flashcards.notes: Two distinct past tense systems. Moments ago uses -o- prefix pattern (Do-/Two-, Wo-/Mwo-, O-/Mo-). Early today uses different prefixes (Ndi-/Twi-, Wi-/Mwi-, E-/Me-) with -ire perfect ending

flashcards.english: 1st Singular: Ĩngĩmenya ingĩka atĩa? (if I knew, what would I do?), 1st Plural: Tũngĩmenya tũngĩka atĩa? (if we knew...), 2nd Singular: Ũngĩmenya ũngĩka atĩa? (if you knew...), 2nd Plural: Mũngĩmenya mũngĩka atĩa? (if you all knew...), 3rd Singular: Angĩmenya angĩka atĩa? (if he/she knew...), 3rd Plural: Mangĩmenya mangĩka atĩa? (if they knew...)
flashcards.notes: Conditional tense pattern: Subject + ngĩ + verb. Examples: Ĩngĩmenya kwaria Gĩkũyũ, no njare Gĩkũyũ (if I could speak Kikuyu, I would speak...), Ũngĩhota gũtwarithia ndege, ũngĩmĩtwara kũ? (if you could fly an aircraft, where would you take it?)
